rounds.comments: (Alex: Each of the correct responses will begin with one, the other or perhaps both of those letters of the alphabet.)

clues.text: This adjective often precedes donna, facie & ballerina
Getting one of these from the governor might save you from the chair
You don't have to be a ruler to wear this size of pantyhose
This god of the sea was closely associated with horses; in fact, he was Pegasus' papa
Two-word phrase for the "floral road" of pleasure & self-indulgence
Legend says the name of this city comes from "handwerpen", meaning "hand thrown"
The Groote Kerk is the "big cheese" among churches in this Dutch city
The name of this Belgian resort is now used to mean any place with mineral springs
The world-famous Concertgebouw Orchestra is based in this city
The monarch of Luxembourg is not a king but one of these
On March 9 General Motors admitted it had investigated this author of "Unsafe at Any Speed"
In November his wife, Lurleen, was elected to succeed him as Governor of Alabama
This Communist Party General Secretary was awarded the title Hero of the Soviet Union
Sargent Shriver gave up the post of director of this program established in 1961
In a March 24 decision the Supreme Court barred this tax for voting in state elections
Of Joseph Andrews, Henry Fielding & Tom Jones, the one who wrote the other 2
Both his "Victory" & "Lord Jim" have been called "Hamletesque"
Bernard Marx works at the Hatchery and Conditioning Centre in this futuristic tale
In 1972 Frederick Forsyth pulled out this "file" on former SS officers
This 1819 Sir Walter Scott novel could also be called "Wilfred", the character's first name
About 1/4 of the Earth's total oil reserves lies under this Mideast country
A caldera is formed by the collapse of the cone of one of these
Used in fluorescent lamps & in arc welding, it's the 3rd most abundant gas in the atmosphere
For most of its distance, the International Date Line follows this meridian
These 2 belts above the earth consist of electrically charged particles
The Concise Columbia Encyclopedia calls this '50s war "the one major 'hot war'" of the Cold War
It began in earnest in 1337 when Edward of England named himself King of France & invaded
The second of these wars is also called the Hannibalic War
This Mexican general lost his leg during the Pastry War
The six days of the Six-Day War in 1967 were in this month
The first toy advertised on national TV was this spud
This card game named for a suit is also called Black Maria
It was introduced in 1969 as "the world's first indoor ball"
You'll find Sweetie Potamus & Veggie Potamus as 2 of the 4 characters in this "frenzied marble chomping game"
A mooshroom is a kind of cow found only in the mushroom biome in this video game
A 2012 inductee to the World Golf Hall of Fame, he's been nicknamed "Phil the Thrill"
The International Swimming Hall of Fame's first class of inductees had 2 movie Tarzans: Buster Crabbe & this man
Between them 2015  Baseball Hall inductees Randy Johnson & Pedro Martinez won 8 of these awards
This Tennis Hall of Famer earned greater fame for his 1973 "Battle of the Sexes" match than for his 3 Wimbledon titles
This Bulls forward, second fiddle to Michael Jordan, made the Hall of Fame 1 year after Mike
Crown, cementum, root
Agitator, tub, drain hose
Reservoir, filter basket, carafe
Random number generator, reels, payout tray
Myelin sheath, dendrite, axon
A statute, or a division in a play
It's haw's proverbial partner when you hesitate
A mongrel dog
An area of wet, spongy ground with soil mainly of decayed vegetable matter
Pallid, or lacking color
Your present spouse is your this 2-word phrase
Your future spouse is your this word
To hurt someone who trusts you
It designates any constellation's second-brightest star
Pair it with "between" to mean in an awkward middle position
Take you from your loft in Soho to a gallery across Houston in this "village"? Tell ya the truth, it'd be faster to walk
Sure, I can take you to this L.A. sports arena where Kobe plays; you know it doesn't sell office supplies, right?
Oui, we are at 27 Rue de Fleurus, Paris, where this writer lived with Alice B. Toklas! We are not a lost generation!
Maggie Daley Park to Soldier Field, sure--we'll take da 41, aka this "Drive" with a water view
Pall Mall? Sure, guv, but it might get slow at this intersection of Regent & Haymarket-- it's a real circus

rounds.text: In her only kids' book, she says, "There was Rose. Rose was her name & would she have been Rose if her name had not been Rose"
